This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question.

(10 points, suggested time 20 minutes)

Two sealed containers each contain a sample of the same ideal gas. Container <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> with gas at initial temperature <math alttext="293 kelvins" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>293</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>K</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed into thermal contact with container <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, containing gas that is maintained at a temperature <math alttext="540 kelvins" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>540</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"></mspace><mi>K</mi></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> by a heater, as shown above. Container <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a piston that is locked in place. The system of the containers and heater is insulated from its surroundings.

(a) In which direction will energy flow when the containers are initially put into thermal contact? Identify the behavior of the gas particles in the two containers that is different and is responsible for this energy flow.
(b) Explain how energy is transferred between the containers on a microscopic scale.

(c) Container <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a fixed volume. As the gas in container <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> gets hotter, it eventually reaches equilibrium at <math alttext="540 kelvins" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>540</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. On the axes below, sketch the process the gas in container <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> goes through as it gets hotter. Indicate the direction of the process with an arrow.

(d) The piston in container <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is unlocked, and the gas is allowed to expand through the process shown in the graph below of pressure <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of volume <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

i. What is the change in the internal energy of the gas in container <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> as a result of the process shown? Support your answer.
ii. Calculate the work done on the gas as it expands.
